c74object.name: the.mc.live.rec~
c74object.digest: Continuously record and store a stream of audio of specific length
c74object.description:
Written by Tim Heinze Â© 2023, www.xenorama.com.
Records running audio of a specified length into a temporary buffer to be played back at any time.

attribute.name: dither
attribute.description: Enable triangular dithering when writing PCM (integer) files.

enum.name: Off
enum.digest: Apply no dithering when writing PCM files

enum.name: Dither
enum.digest: Apply triangular dither (TPDF) when writing PCM files

enum.name: Dither + Noise Shaping
enum.digest: Apply triangular dither with noise shaping (HP-TPDF) when writing PCM files

attribute.name: filetype
attribute.description: The audio file format used by the buffer~ object. The default file type is AIFF.

attribute.name: format
attribute.description:
The bit depth or sample type of the buffer on disk
For backward compatibility, the following numeric valus can be used to set format, in addition to the symbolic names below:
8 - 8-bit integer
16 - 16-bit integer
24 - 24-bit integer
32 - 32-bit integer

attribute.name: loop
attribute.description: Toggle looped playback. The default is "1" (enable loop)

attribute.name: quantization
attribute.description: Select the quantization rule when writing PCM (integer) files.

enum.name: Round
enum.digest: Round when quantizing to integer values.

enum.name: Floor
enum.digest: Floor when quantizing to integer values.

attribute.name: samps
attribute.digest: length of the buffer~ in samples
attribute.description: The length of the buffer~ expressed in samples.

attribute.name: size
attribute.digest: length of the buffer~ in milliseconds
attribute.description: The length of the buffer~ expressed in milliseconds. If succeeded by the word "seconds" or "secs" will interpret the given number by a multiple of seconds.

method.name: multichannelsignal
method.description: Audio signal to record. Channelcount of internal buffer~ will be updated accordingly.

method.name: play
method.description: Playback any previously recorded audio. Playback is stopped by the stop method.

method.name: record
method.description: Begin recording. Recording is stopped by the stop method.

method.name: stop
method.description: Stop recording or playback. Stopping is necessary before recording or playing back.

method.name: write
method.digest: Write the contents of buffer~ to an audio file
method.description: Saves the contents of buffer~ into an audio file. A standard file dialog is opened for naming the file unless the word write is followed by a symbol, in which case the file is saved in the current default folder, using the symbol as the filename. Unless you change the format with the Format pop-up menu in the standard Save As dialog box, the file will be saved in the format specified by the filetype attribute, or the file type of the most recently opened audio file. By default, buffer~ saves in AIFF format.
